markdownRemark.html:
Hey,

Vim is far from perfect, you’re right about that! I started with Vim long before Atom was a thing and have always liked it, despite the obvious drawbacks.

Even when I switched to Atom, I found myself longing for the keyboard shortcuts and presets that keep me feeling young.

Vim isn’t for everyone, especially if you’ve started with a modern text editor like Atom (Vi came out in 76, Vim came out in 91, it’s old AF).

That being said, I’d like to help you address your issues. In terms of syntax highlighting, there’s something called Tigris that can help you get there. It’s a little buggy though -> https://github.com/billyvg/tigris.nvim

I’m assuming you’re talking about vertical line-spacing. You’ll have to control that through iTerm.

Ale will let you set your own characters if you’re not a fan of “>>”. You can switch it to the • character if that makes it more pleasing.

I’m not quite sure what you mean by the tildes in your setup but check out mine here and see if mine looks different: https://github.com/peterpme/dotfiles/tree/master/config/nvim

Thanks for your thoughtful post! Hopefully some of my answers will help you get to where you want to be :)
